meanings.def: an adult male human
examples: a good-looking young man
the relationships between men and women
the men's team/game/race/doubles/singles/event
The board of directors is dominated by middle-aged white men.
He was one of the great men of history.
Four armed men burst into the room.
An elderly Indian man sat down beside me and recounted his story.
He is an average working man trying to make ends meet.
The men's team won their third gold medal last year.
The picture shows a man in his thirties.
the man she sits next to at work
I gave some money to a homeless man in the park.
Is Jim Carrey the funniest man on earth?
He walked out of court a free man.
He was a lucky man to have found such a partner.
He was a self-made man who raised himself from poverty to success.
Mr Locke is a man of means who owns a vast business empire.
Police have arrested two men and a woman.
I was helped by two burly men with tattoos.
Over 150 men, women and children were killed.
Several people made speeches in honour of the great man.
Vincente is a wanted man back in his own country.
What a horrible man!
men in grey suits
a little old man
a middle-aged, balding man
Only the dead man's young son knows what happened.

meanings.def: humans as a group, both male and female
examples: the damage caused by man to the environment
The common man (= ordinary people) is losing faith in democratic institutions.
the most poisonous substance known to man
It's a powerful indictment of the horrors of war and man's inhumanity to man.
In man the brain is highly developed.
The working man wants more and better jobs.

meanings.def: a person, either male or female
examples: All men must die.
How could a human torture his fellow man?
While no man is an island, we do function independently for the most part.

meanings.def: humans from a particular period of history
examples: early/modern/Prehistoric man

meanings.def: a man who comes from the place mentioned or whose job or interest is connected with the thing mentioned
examples: a Frenchman
a sportsman
a businessman
a medical man

meanings.def: a man who likes or who does the thing mentioned
examples: a betting/fighting/drinking man
I think he’s a beer man (= he drinks beer).
I've never been a gambling man.

meanings.def: a man who works for or supports a particular organization, comes from a particular town, etc.
examples: the BBC’s man in Moscow (= the man who reports on news from Moscow)
a loyal Republican Party man

meanings.def: a soldier or a male worker who obeys the instructions of a person of higher rank
examples: The officer refused to let his men take part in the operation.
The conditions in which the men were working were terrible.

meanings.def: a man who comes to your house to do a job
examples: the gas man
The man's coming to repair the TV today.

meanings.def: used for addressing a male person
examples: Nice shirt, man!
Hey man. Back off!

meanings.def: used for addressing a male person in an angry or impatient way
examples: Don't just stand there, man—get a doctor!

meanings.def: a person's husband, boyfriend or male partner
examples: What's her new man like?
I now pronounce you man and wife (= you are now officially married).

meanings.def: a person who is strong and brave or has other qualities that some people think are typically male
examples: Come on, now—be a man.
She's more of a man than he is.

meanings.def: a group or person that is thought to be in authority or control, especially the police or white people in government
examples: Activists marched to the police station to voice their displeasure with the Man.

meanings.def: a male servant
examples: My man will drive you home.

meanings.def: one of the figures or objects that you play with in a game such as chess
with everyone doing or thinking the same thing at the same time; in agreement
examples: The crowd rose to their feet as one man.
The staff speak as one man on this issue.

meanings.def: to please everyone by changing your attitudes or opinions to suit different people
to be understood or used in different ways by different people
to be the best or most suitable person to do a particular job, etc.
examples: For a superb haircut, David's your man.

meanings.def: to be strong or brave enough
examples: He was not man enough to face up to his responsibility.

meanings.def: to act or think independently, not following others or being ordered
examples: Working for himself meant that he could be his own man.

meanings.def: people must take care of themselves and not give or expect any help
examples: In business, it's every man for himself.

meanings.def: a man who is respected in a particular profession that he has been involved in for a long time
examples: James Lovelock, the grand old man of environmental science

meanings.def: (not) in exactly the same words as somebody says were used
examples: ‘Did she say she was sorry?’ ‘Not in so many words.’
He didn't approve of the plan and said so in as many words.
They told me in so many words that I was no longer needed.

meanings.def: with a lot of force or energy
examples: He flew out of the room like a man possessed.

meanings.def: to make a young man develop and become more adult
examples: They thought the army would make a man of him.

meanings.def: a man who frequently goes to fashionable parties, clubs, theatres, etc.
examples: In his new suit, he looked quite the man about town.

meanings.def: a man/woman who likes the same things or has the same opinions as you
from when somebody was young to when they were old or older
examples: He's been doing the same job for 50 years—man and boy.

meanings.def: an average or ordinary person, either male or female
examples: Politicians often don't understand the views of the man in the street.
What really matters to the man and woman in the street?

meanings.def: a religious man, especially a priest or a clergyman
a man who is chosen as having given the best performance in a game of football (soccer), cricket, etc.
examples: Pogba was named man of the match.

meanings.def: the man who is the best at a particular point in time
examples: Man of the moment Tom Ford greets the crowd at the end of his show.

meanings.def: a person with many skills
a man/woman who understands and supports ordinary people
examples: He is not only a statesman, but also a man of the people.

meanings.def: a rich and powerful man or woman
a person with a lot of experience of life, who is not easily surprised or shocked
a way of describing a dog
a person’s home is a place where they can be private and safe and do as they like
a man who is more popular with men than with women
between two men who are treating each other honestly and equally
examples: I'm telling you all this man to man.
a man-to-man talk

meanings.def: a person who is in danger because their enemies want to harm them
examples: He has been a marked man since he decided to cooperate with the police.

meanings.def: the average person
examples: I can enjoy a joke as well as the next man, but this is going too far.

meanings.def: a person or thing that is different from others or does not fit easily into a group or set
examples: At school he was always the odd man out.
Dog, cat, horse, shoe—which is the odd one out?

meanings.def: used to say that different people like different things; what one person likes very much, another person does not like at all
a person or thing that is similar to but of a lower quality than a particular famous person or thing
examples: Sparkling white wine is the poor man's champagne.

meanings.def: to show or prove who is brave, skilful, etc. and who is not
used to emphasize that something is true of all the people being described
examples: They answered ‘Yes,’ to a man.
They were all destroyed, to the last man.

meanings.def: a person who is determined or wants something very much will succeed

idioms.def: with everyone doing or thinking the same thing at the same time; in agreement
examples: The crowd rose to their feet as one man.
The staff speak as one man on this issue.

idioms.idiom: be all things to all men/people
idioms.def: to please everyone by changing your attitudes or opinions to suit different people
to be the best or most suitable person to do a particular job, etc.
examples: For a superb haircut, David's your man.

idioms.idiom: be man enough (to do something/for something)
idioms.def: to be strong or brave enough
examples: He was not man enough to face up to his responsibility.

idioms.def: to act or think independently, not following others or being ordered
examples: Working for himself meant that he could be his own man.

idioms.def: people must take care of themselves and not give or expect any help
examples: In business, it's every man for himself.

idioms.def: a man who is respected in a particular profession that he has been involved in for a long time
examples: James Lovelock, the grand old man of environmental science

idioms.def: (not) in exactly the same words as somebody says were used
examples: ‘Did she say she was sorry?’ ‘Not in so many words.’
He didn't approve of the plan and said so in as many words.
They told me in so many words that I was no longer needed.

idioms.idiom: like a man/woman possessed | like one possessed
idioms.def: with a lot of force or energy
examples: He flew out of the room like a man possessed.

idioms.def: to make a young man develop and become more adult
examples: They thought the army would make a man of him.

idioms.def: a man who frequently goes to fashionable parties, clubs, theatres, etc.
examples: In his new suit, he looked quite the man about town.

idioms.idiom: a man/woman after your own heart
idioms.def: a man/woman who likes the same things or has the same opinions as you
from when somebody was young to when they were old or older
examples: He's been doing the same job for 50 years—man and boy.

idioms.idiom: the man (and/or woman) in the street
idioms.def: an average or ordinary person, either male or female
examples: Politicians often don't understand the views of the man in the street.
What really matters to the man and woman in the street?

idioms.def: a religious man, especially a priest or a clergyman
a man who is chosen as having given the best performance in a game of football (soccer), cricket, etc.
examples: Pogba was named man of the match.

idioms.def: the man who is the best at a particular point in time
examples: Man of the moment Tom Ford greets the crowd at the end of his show.

idioms.def: a person with many skills
a man/woman who understands and supports ordinary people
examples: He is not only a statesman, but also a man of the people.

idioms.def: a rich and powerful man or woman
a person with a lot of experience of life, who is not easily surprised or shocked
a way of describing a dog

idioms.idiom: a man’s home is his castle
idioms.def: a person’s home is a place where they can be private and safe and do as they like
a man who is more popular with men than with women
between two men who are treating each other honestly and equally
examples: I'm telling you all this man to man.
a man-to-man talk

idioms.def: a person who is in danger because their enemies want to harm them
examples: He has been a marked man since he decided to cooperate with the police.

idioms.idiom: the next man, woman, person, etc.
idioms.def: the average person
examples: I can enjoy a joke as well as the next man, but this is going too far.

idioms.def: a person or thing that is different from others or does not fit easily into a group or set
examples: At school he was always the odd man out.
Dog, cat, horse, shoe—which is the odd one out?

idioms.idiom: one man’s meat is another man’s poison
idioms.def: used to say that different people like different things; what one person likes very much, another person does not like at all
a person or thing that is similar to but of a lower quality than a particular famous person or thing
examples: Sparkling white wine is the poor man's champagne.

idioms.idiom: separate/sort out the men from the boys
idioms.def: to show or prove who is brave, skilful, etc. and who is not

idioms.idiom: to a man | to the last man
idioms.def: used to emphasize that something is true of all the people being described
examples: They answered ‘Yes,’ to a man.
They were all destroyed, to the last man.

idioms.idiom: you can’t keep a good man down
idioms.def: a person who is determined or wants something very much will succeed

meanings.def: to work at a place or be in charge of a place or a machine
examples: Soldiers manned barricades around the city.
The telephones are manned 24 hours a day by volunteers.

meanings.def: used to express surprise, anger, etc.
examples: Man, that was great!
